videos.headline: Laszewski sinks layup in transition
videos.description: Notre Dame guard TJ Gibbs tosses the ball ahead to forward Nate Laszewski for a easy layup in transition.

videos.headline: Notre Dame scores on 3 straight possessions
videos.description: Notre Dame's Rex Pflueger, John Mooney and Prentiss Hubb quickly gets easy baskets on 3 straight possessions.

videos.headline: Reynolds' steal leads to Calixte's 3-pointer
videos.description: Oklahoma G Miles Reynolds comes up with a steal and then finds G Aaron Calixte fora 3-pointer in transition.

videos.headline: Durham flies in for big dunk
videos.description: Notre Dame's Prentiss Hubb passes the ball to a driving Juwan Durham, who rises up for a powerful one-handed dunk.

article.description: Christian James scored a game-high 25 points and grabbed 10 rebounds to lead Oklahoma to an 85-80 win over Notre Dame in the first game of the Jimmy V Classic Tuesday at Madison Square Garden.

video.headline: James drains 3-pointer with defender in his face
video.caption: While being heavily guarded, Oklahoma's Christian James pulls up from downtown and knocks down a tough 3-pointer late in the second half.
video.description: While being heavily guarded, Oklahoma's Christian James pulls up from downtown and knocks down a tough 3-pointer late in the second half.
video.title: James drains 3-pointer with defender in his face

article.headline: Oklahoma beats Notre Dame, 85-80 to open the Jimmy V Classic

images.name: James drains 3-pointer with defender in his face
images.caption: While being heavily guarded, Oklahoma's Christian James pulls up from downtown and knocks down a tough 3-pointer late in the second half.

article.linkText: Oklahoma beats Notre Dame, 85-80 to open the Jimmy V Classic
article.story: NEW YORK -- Mike Brey couldn't help but be envious. He watched as Lon Kruger was able to depend on experienced players in the late moments of a close contest. It was a luxury Brey had not so long ago. "An older team played older tonight," Brey said after Oklahoma outlasted Notre Dame, 85-80, in the first game of the Jimmy V Classic Tuesday at Madison Square Garden. "Oklahoma is an older group and they played older than us." Christian James scored a game-high 25 points and grabbed 10 rebounds for the Sooners, who improved to 7-1 with their third straight win. Brady Manek chipped in 17. Aaron Calixte finished with 12, and Matt Freeman 11. "Proud of our guys," Kruger said. "They hung in there." Despite an 18-point performance from TJ Gibbs, Notre Dame dropped to 6-2 with its first loss since Nov. 14. Juwan Durham and John Mooney had 15 each, and DJ Harvey finished with 11. "The offensive flow is a work in progress for us," Brey said. The first-ever meeting between the programs was a back-and-forth affair throughout. Leading by seven at the start of the second half, Oklahoma extended its lead to 47-36 after Calixte knocked down a jumper. The Irish replied with a 21-9 run, capped by a Durham dunk to close within 57-56. Seconds after Durham's jam, a James layup allowed Oklahoma to push its lead to three, and the Sooners would lead by as many as seven following a Freeman 3. But the Irish would not go away, cutting the deficit to 78-77 after Prentiss Hubb's layup with 2:26 left. That was as close as Notre Dame would come. "We've been blessed with upperclassmen in all 20 of my years until this year," Brey said. "I just (have) to remember to be patient and keep teaching and let guys blossom." James' jumper pushed the lead back to three, and he drilled a 3 to give the Sooners an 83-78 lead. "They fought and battled," Kruger said. Oklahoma outscored Notre Dame 12-6 in the final 4:26 of the first half and led 43-36 at halftime. BIG PICTURE: NOTRE DAME: The NCAA ranked the Irish as the third best 3-point shooting team in men's college basketball since the turn of the century, trailing only Duke and Belmont. Notre Dame's marksmanship behind the arc did not carry over to Madison Square Garden, as the Irish shot 28.0 (7 for 25) percent from 3. OKLAHOMA: Coaches value having a go-to scorer and scoring depth. In his ninth year at Oklahoma, Kruger appears to have both. Entering Tuesday night's nationally televised game, senior guard Christian James led the team with 19.1 points per game, while Jamuni McNeace (9.9 PPG), Miles Reynolds (9.1 PPG), Aaron Calixte (9.0 PPG) and Brady Manek (8.9 PPG) have also contributed offensively. UP NEXT: NOTRE DAME: Travels to UCLA Saturday night. OKLAHOMA: Hosts Wichita State Saturday. --- More AP college basketball: https://apnews.com/Collegebasketball and https://twitter.com/AP-Top25

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
